                            </gmd:code>

                    </gmd:identifier>
                    
                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                        <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                            <gmd:organisationName>
                                <gco:CharacterString>Souris and Area Branch of the PEI Wildlife Federation (SAB)</gco:CharacterString>
                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>

                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                        <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                            <gmd:organisationName>
                                <gco:CharacterString>Souris and Area Branch of the PEI Wildlife Federation (SAB)</gco:CharacterString>
                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"

                            </gmd:role>
                        </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Souris and Area Wildlife Branch installs data loggers in many of our watershed systems where we implement large amounts of habitat work or where we have done considerable restoration work over the last number of years.  Water quality data loggers are also installed in rivers in our management area where future rehabilitation efforts will take place. Loggers are placed in designated stream habitat assessment monitoring sites and in various reaches of our watersheds to help determine the temperature of the water and the amount of light that filters through the water.

Many have been deployed to monitor water temperature to help build a database of water quality for our management area so that we are consistently monitoring specific habitat sites especially headwater areas in our rivers.  Headwaters are so important because their stability aids in landscape processes and downstream waters through their influence on the supply, transport, and fate of water and solutes in our watersheds.

Water quality data loggers are meaningful tools in all of our watersheds to aid in monitoring water temperature variations in prime stream reaches, particularly spawning zones so that accurate and appropriate measures may be taken to ensure fish habitat and fish populations are secure and at a healthy level in each of our managed watersheds.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

                codeListValue="onGoing">onGoing</gmd:MD_ProgressCode>

            </gmd:descriptiveKeywords>

            </gmd:language>

            </gmd:topicCategory>

                            </gmd:westBoundLongitude>

                                <gco:Decimal>-62.159336</gco:Decimal>
                            </gmd:eastBoundLongitude>
                            <gmd:southBoundLatitude>
                                <gco:Decimal>46.3251</gco:Decimal>
                            </gmd:southBoundLatitude>
                            <gmd:northBoundLatitude>
                                <gco:Decimal>46.46843</gco:Decimal>
                            </gmd:northBoundLatitude>
                        </gmd:EX_GeographicBoundingBox>
                    </gmd:geographicElement>
                    <gmd:temporalElement>

                                    <gml:endPosition>2019-12-04T03:51:00-04:00</gml:endPosition>
                                </gml:TimePeriod>

                        </gmd:EX_TemporalExtent>
                    </gmd:temporalElement>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-qrng-ah51
notes:
Souris and Area Wildlife Branch installs data loggers in many of our watershed systems where we implement large amounts of habitat work or where we have done considerable restoration work over the last number of years.  Water quality data loggers are also installed in rivers in our management area where future rehabilitation efforts will take place. Loggers are placed in designated stream habitat assessment monitoring sites and in various reaches of our watersheds to help determine the temperature of the water and the amount of light that filters through the water.

Many have been deployed to monitor water temperature to help build a database of water quality for our management area so that we are consistently monitoring specific habitat sites especially headwater areas in our rivers.  Headwaters are so important because their stability aids in landscape processes and downstream waters through their influence on the supply, transport, and fate of water and solutes in our watersheds.

Water quality data loggers are meaningful tools in all of our watersheds to aid in monitoring water temperature variations in prime stream reaches, particularly spawning zones so that accurate and appropriate measures may be taken to ensure fish habitat and fish populations are secure and at a healthy level in each of our managed watersheds.

notes_translated.en:
Souris and Area Wildlife Branch installs data loggers in many of our watershed systems where we implement large amounts of habitat work or where we have done considerable restoration work over the last number of years.  Water quality data loggers are also installed in rivers in our management area where future rehabilitation efforts will take place. Loggers are placed in designated stream habitat assessment monitoring sites and in various reaches of our watersheds to help determine the temperature of the water and the amount of light that filters through the water.

Many have been deployed to monitor water temperature to help build a database of water quality for our management area so that we are consistently monitoring specific habitat sites especially headwater areas in our rivers.  Headwaters are so important because their stability aids in landscape processes and downstream waters through their influence on the supply, transport, and fate of water and solutes in our watersheds.

Water quality data loggers are meaningful tools in all of our watersheds to aid in monitoring water temperature variations in prime stream reaches, particularly spawning zones so that accurate and appropriate measures may be taken to ensure fish habitat and fish populations are secure and at a healthy level in each of our managed watersheds.
notes_translated.fr:
La Direction de la faune de Souris et de la région installe des enregistreurs de données dans bon nombre de nos réseaux hydrographiques où nous effectuons de grands travaux d'habitat ou où nous avons effectué d'importants travaux de restauration au cours des dernières années. Des enregistreurs de données sur la qualité de l'eau sont également installés dans les rivières de notre zone de gestion où de futurs efforts de réhabilitation auront lieu. Les bûcherons sont placés sur des sites de surveillance désignés pour l'évaluation de l'habitat des cours d'eau et dans diverses parties de nos bassins versants pour aider à déterminer la température de l'eau et la quantité de lumière qui filtre l'eau.

Nombre d'entre eux ont été déployés pour surveiller la température de l'eau afin de créer une base de données sur la qualité de l'eau pour notre zone de gestion, afin que nous surveillions constamment des sites d'habitat spécifiques, en particulier les zones d'amont de nos rivières. Les eaux d'amont sont si importantes parce que leur stabilité favorise les processus du paysage et les eaux en aval en influant sur l'approvisionnement, le transport et le devenir de l'eau et des solutés dans nos bassins versants.

Les enregistreurs de données sur la qualité de l'eau sont des outils utiles dans tous nos bassins versants pour aider à surveiller les variations de température de l'eau dans les principaux tronçons des cours d'eau, en particulier dans les zones de frai, afin que des mesures précises et appropriées puissent être prises pour garantir la sécurité et la santé de l'habitat des poissons et des populations de poissons dans chacun de nos bassins hydrographiques gérés.

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
